record.creatorPhotographer: William A. Hiltner and Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar
record.description: Total solar eclipse July 9 photographed by University of Chicago astronomers and professors Hiltner and Chandrasekhar at a remote site in Manitoba, Canada, 1,200 miles north of Chicago. The camera was equipped with a 4-inch lens, exposure of only five seconds, and shows the sun’s inner corona. Skies had cleared just before the eclipse, which lasted for 37 seconds. Other astronomical expeditions ran into bad weather and did not get pictures.
